Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough scientific evidence to support the statement that high temperatures kill the novel coronavirus.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that letting a fever run high will help get rid of the coronavirus, which may not be true for everyone.
Exist alternative explanation: The expert suggests that while a high temperature can help the body fight off a virus, there may be other factors involved in the case of the novel coronavirus.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that it is not yet known whether a fever makes it harder for the novel coronavirus to survive.
Understate: The claim may understate the potential dangers of running a high fever, as mentioned by the expert.
Falters at times: The claim falters by not considering factors such as age, general health, and other symptoms when determining whether to treat a fever.
Exaggerate: None identified in the given information.
